data.title: DR - Cork Past and Present
data.text: 100 CASTLELYONS.-CASTLE3IAGNER. [CLOYNE. the amount of which is unknown. No charge an the parish in 1832 on account of the church. Divine service is celebrated twice on Sundays in summer and once in winter, and on the principal festivals. The .sacrament is administered eight times in the year. The rectorial, consisting of two-thirds of the tithes of this parish, compounded for £1,142 7s. 5d., are impropriate, and held under lease byJoseph B. Ryder, clerk, from the representatives of Mr. Travers. [Parl. Rep.] 1849. A faculty was issued for the repair of the church. [D.R.] 1860. P. Berry, Vicar. Samuel Penrose, Curate. Noglebehouse . 9 acres of glebe in Vicar's use. Incumbent absent from ill-health. Divine service twice on all Sundays, and once on the usual holidays. Sacrament monthly, average of communicants, 21 ; and on the three chief festivals, average, 34. 21 children attend a school maintained by Vicar. The Protestant population is 148. The rentcharge is £428 7s. 9d. The land is worth £13. Total value, £441 7s. 9d, without residence. P. Berry (son of - Berry, esq., by -, daughter of Rev. Philip Homan), is a younger brother of Thomas Berry, esq., of Hume-street, Dublin, and was first-cousin to his predecessor, who resigned in his favour. He graduated A.B., T.C.D. in 1823, and AX. in 1832. In 1825 he was Curate of St. Stephen's, Dublin. In 1862 he resigned Castlelyons. 1862. November 1. JAMES GWYNN, A.M., V. Castle-Lyons als Castleleghane. [D.R.] James Gwynn (brother of Rev. John Gwynn, F.T.C.D., who was ordained Deacon at Cork, on 18th Dec., 1853), was a Scholar of T.C.D. in 1848, and obtained a Senior Moderatorship in Ethics and Logics, and graduated A.B. in 1861. He was for some time Curate of St. Anne's, Dublin. Mr. Gwvnne, who was a widower when he came to Cloyne diocese`in 1858, married, secondly, on 13th January, 1863, Jane, eldest daughter of Charles Osborne, esq., of Down End, Hants. CASTLEMAGNER. 1291. " Ecca de 31unemanarrach XXs. unde decia Hs." [Tax. P. Nic.] "E. Monymandragh idem cunt Castlemagner." [V.B. of 1670.] 1591. "E. Ville Castri-R. spectat ad Bothon. EDMUND MAGNER est Vicar." [M1S. T.C.D. E. 3. 14.] 1615. PETER BETESWORTH (P. Subulter, q.v.) is Vicar ; and Emanuel Phaire (P. Kilmaclenrne, q. v.) is Curate. "R. inipropriata, Jokes Jephson, miles, firmarius. Vicariam Betesworth habet, CLOYNE.] CA STLESIAGNER. 101 studendi gratia, per quinquennium. Valet 4 li. per annum. Curatus Emanuel Phaire, minister et predicator." [R.V. R.I.A.] 1616. September 23. PATRICK COYNE is admitted V. Castlemagner and Kilbrin, and P. Subulter, q. v. 1618. Thomas Fitzmaurice, Baron of Kerry and Lisnaw, had a grant on 6th June, 1618, of the advowsons of V. Castlemagner, Kilbrowuey, Baliyclogh, Killenballiuaglish, and Dunbuliog. [Ferguson's AISS., vol. ii. 309.] 1634. E. de Castlena rner spectat ad Ballybeg. Val. 15 li. per an. Vicar, Patrick Coyne. Val. 15 li. per an. E. de Kilbrin spectat ad Ballebege. Val. 20 Ii. Johes Jephson, miles, Impropriator. V. Pat. Coyne. Val. 20 li. [R.V. 1634.] Kilniabo Serulane, Julies Jepbson, linpropriator. Mullis curatus. [MSS. Consistorial Office, Dublin.] 1661. Vicaria vacat. [V.B.] 1662. July 28. EDWARD BtLLEN is admitted, per mortem Patricii Coyne, V. Castlemagner, Ro,_eri Calvi, et Kilbrin. [1).R.] Bullen appears at the visitation of 2nd August, 1G70. He was also P. Kilnaglory, Cork, q. v. 1670/1. April 17. JOHN W EBB is admitted (rice Bullen) V. Castlemagner, Killn-in, and R. Templeroan. [F.F.] He was also Chancellor of Cloyne, q. v. 1679. The conuuuuion plate, now (1863) in Castlemagner Church, consists of a cup and paten of silver, weighing, together, a pound and a half. On the cup is this le_rend-" This Cup belongs to the Parish Church of Castlemagner, 1679." 1685. Nov. 14. Gieneit°r HEATHCOTE, A.M. (dice Webb) is admitted V. Castlemagner; Rogeri Calvi, Kilbrin, and Chancellor of Cloyne, q. v. 1693. June 26. EDWARD SAYERS (vice Heatheote, deprived), V. Castlemagner; Rogeri Calvi, Kilbrin, and Chancellor of Cloyne, q. v. 1694. V. Castlemagner ; val. 10 pounds. Mr. Sayers, Incumbent. Epus patronus. Church of Castlemagner much damnified by the late war, but now in repairing. Impropriator of Castlemagner, Air. Jephson olio, Dune vendit Johi Longfleld. It. imp v al. 20 pounds. [Palliser.] 1713. April 18. ROBERT CARLETON, A.M. (vie, Sayers, resigned), V. Castlem inner, and on same day V. Ball vclogh and Dromdowney, per cession of Tennison. Dean of Cork, q. v. [D.R.] In 17 21 Carleton became 1713 to 1799. Castlemagner was held with BallyclVh, q. v. 1799. March 14. JOHN M`CORMICa, A.B., V. Castlemagner. In 1804 he became V. Ballyclogh, q. v. [F. F.] 1804. Feb 25. JAMES HAMILTON (vice .11'Cormick, resigned), V. Castlemagner. P.R.] In 1805 he became V. Bregoge, q. v. 1805. August 7. SACKVILLE ROBERT HAMILTON (cite James Hamilton,
